author: Anonymous Comp
title: summing the areas
question:
Hi, 
At 2021w-md1 q4, we should design a function that consumes a list of images as its first argument and a number as its second argument.  The function should produce the sum of the areas of just those images with areas greater than the number.
The solution consist a condition:
(define (sum-areas-greater-than loi n)
  (cond [(empty? loi) 0]
        [else
         (+ (if (> (image-area (first loi)) n)
                (image-area (first loi))
                0)
              (sum-areas-greater-than (rest loi) n))]))
 When we add the area (or 0) - where it is going? I am adding it to what? a hidden initial zero?
I saw it on another question that we needed to add 1.
student_answer:
The
0
in this case (
1
in the other cases you've seen) just represents the base case.

In this case, the "empty" at the end of the list.
